attributes.title: Development of prototypes for balconies and loggias of infra-lightweight concrete (ILC) @ Bautechnik early view
attributes.content:
Publication (only in German):
Mendgen, A. (2023) Entwicklung von Prototypen für Balkone und
Loggien aus Infraleichtbeton (ILC) unter Berücksichtigung bauphysikalischer
Aspekte und der Anforderungen aus der Fertigung. Bautechnik.
[https://doi.org/10.1002/bate.202100098](https://doi.org/10.1002/bate.202100098)



Within the framework of the DBU funded research project ILVO
prefabricated elements made of ILC were developed from 2019
until 2021. The resulting prototypes were exhibited in 2022/2023
in the form of models at the exhibition “Technoscape: The Architecture
of Engineers” (curators: Maristella Casciato, Pippo
Ciorra) at MAXXI Museum in Rome. Building with Infra-Lightweight
Concrete (ILC) can offer several advantages in comparison
with conventional thermal insulation composite systems. In
multi-story housing this becomes obvious especially where
windows, balconies and loggias are constructed. Details which
are usually complicated and lead to a number of problems in
the areas of thermal bridges can be thought in a new way. In
the following the benefits of building with large-sized components
of ILC are introduced. Further the basic requirements for
the design, construction as well as the production of prototypes
of ILC are explained. The development of three prototypes
(french balcony, balcony and loggia) is shown and evaluated.
Furthermore, a reference is made to serial construction in
building construction and civil engineering.
